Consider the linear applications 

$\begin{array}{cccc}
F: & \mathbb{R}^3 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y, z) & \longrightarrow & (y, x-z)
\end{array}$
$\begin{array}{cccc}
G: & \mathbb{R}^2 & \rightarrow  & \mathbb{R}^2 \\
  & (x, y) & \longrightarrow & (x+y, x-2y)
\end{array}$

Choose the right answer:
answer1: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)$ does not exist
answer2: $(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$and $(G\circ F)$ does not exist
answer3: $(G\circ F)(x, y, z)=(F\circ G)(x, y, z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$
answer4: $(G\circ F)(y, x-z)=(x+y-z, -2x+y+2z)$ and $(F\circ G)(x, y)=(x+y, x-2y)$

question: A sample of 8 medical institutions in the country, found these monthly expenses for stationery (in euros): $69, 48, 99, 87, 93, 84, 80,$ and $98$. How many solutions does the following linear system has?
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & = & 4 \\
x & - & 2y & = & 0 \\
4x & + & 3y & = & 12
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(\frac{24}{11},\,\frac{12}{11}\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has an infinite number of solutions of the form $\left(2y,\,y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Solve the following constraint optimization problem such that $f\left(x,y\right)=x^2+y^2$ subject to $4x^2+y^2=8$.
answer1: It has $2$ local maxima and $2$ local minima.
answer3: It has $1$ local maxima and $1$ local minima.

question: Choose the true statement.
answer1: A concave polygon may have a diagonal outside the polygon.
answer2: A convex polygon may have a diagonal outside the polygon.
answer3: The diagonals of a convex polygon are all congruent.
answer4: A diagonal can join two consecutive vertices of the polygon.

Find the solution of the following system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &-1 \\ 
&x &+ &y &- &5z &= &2
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$\left( -y+\dfrac{1}{3},y, -\frac{1}{3}\right),\, \forall y\in\mathbb{R}$$.
answer2:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters:
$$\left( -y+\dfrac{1}{3}z,y, z\right),\, \forall y,z\in\mathbb{R}$$.

question: Let $F: \mathbb{R}^5\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ be a linear surjective application and $T: \mathbb{R}^4\rightarrow \mathbb{R}^4$ be an invertible linear operator. Choose the correct answer:

Solve the following linear system:
$$\left\{\begin{array}{ccccccccc}
x & + & 3y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2\\
3x & - & y & - & 3z & - & 4w & = & 1\\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3\\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: The system has $(-1,0,0,-1)$ as unique solution.
answer3: The system has $(x, 0, 0, x)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$
answer4: The system has $(x,x-1,x-1,x)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.

-x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
x &+ &3y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$

answer4: The system has $(0,y,y)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Identify the true statement.
answer1: The regular tetrahedron has four geometrically equal faces.
answer2: The tetrahedron has less than four faces.
answer3: The tetrahedron has at least four faces.
answer4: The tetrahedron is a platonic solid.

question: Consider the linear transformation $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$, such that $F(x, y)=(x+2y, 2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$.
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator.
answer4: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, 2x-y)$.

Find the general solution for the differential equation system

$\begin{cases}
x'(t)=2x+y \\
y'(t)=x+3y-z \\
z'(t)=-x+2y+3z
\end{cases}$
answer3:
$\begin{cases}
x(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+C_{2}e^{3t}(2\cos (t)-\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{3t}(\cos (t)+2\sin (t))\\
y(t)=C_{2}e^{3t}(\cos (t)+3\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{3t}(3\cos (t)-\sin (t))\\
z(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+2C_{2}e^{3t}\cos t+3C_{3}e^{3t}\sin t,
\end{cases}$
where $C_{1}, C_{2}, C_{3} \in \mathbb{R}$.
answer4:
$\begin{cases}
x(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+C_{2}e^{t}(2\cos (t)-\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{t}(\cos (t)+2\sin (t))\\
y(t)=C_{2}e^{t}(\cos (t)-3\sin (t))+C_{3}e^{t}(3\cos (t)+\sin (t))\\
z(t)=C_{1}e^{2t}+5C_{2}e^{t}\cos (t)+5C_{3}e^{t}\sin (t),
\end{cases}$
where $C_{1}, C_{2}, C_{3} \in \mathbb{R}$.

Consider in the three-dimensional cartesian system the plane of equation $\pi: 2x-3y+z-1=0$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(-1, -1, 0)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(-4, 6, -2)$.
answer2: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, 3, 1)$.
answer3: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, 1, 1)$ and is normal to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.
answer4: The plane $\pi$ contains the point $P=(1, -1, 0)$ and is parallel to the vector $n=(2, -3, 1)$.

Consider the following linear programming problem to determine the optimum production schedule concerning three products $x_1$, $x_2$ and $x_3$ to maximize the profit regarding Company XLK Lda. The production of these products requires resources 1 and 2. 

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 3x_{1}+x_{2}+5x_{3}\\
\text{subject to} & 6x_{1}+3x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 45 \text{ (Resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+4x_{2}+5x_{3}\leq 30 \text{ (Resource 2)}\\
& x_{i}\geq 0, i=1~to~3\\	
\end{array}
\]	

Let $S_1$ and $S_2$ be the slack variables for the respective constraints. After we
apply the simplex method, the final incomplete simplex tableau is:

\[
\begin{array}{l|ccccc|c}
& x_{1} & x_{2} & x_{3} &  S_{1} & S_{2} & \\
\hline
x_{1} & 1 & -1/3  & 0 &  1/3 & -1/3 & 5 \\
x_{3} & 0 & 1  & 1 &  -1/5 & 2/5 & 3 \\
\hline
& &   & &   & & \\
\end{array}
\]	
Find the allowable range for the coefficient of $x_{3}$ in the objective function based on the final complete simplex tableau.

\]
